Body: I made the mistake of upgrading OTA to Lollipop (5.0.2) since then have been considering flushing the device down the toilet:Unable to answer incoming calls half the time.Unintuitive UI update.Regular drop outs when using as data hotspot.Has anyone managed to get there phone back to KitKat and if so how did you do it?My phone is the Australian Dual Sim unlocked retail version.Apologies to anyone that thinks it is lazy for me not to wade through every generic answer and roll the dice on bricking the phone without at least asking if someone has succeeded (or failed) with identical circumstances.
Title: Has anyone successfully downgraded there moto G v2 from lollipop?

history.Text: I made the mistake of upgrading OTA to Lollipop (5.0.2) since then have been considering flushing the device down the toilet:  - Unable to answer incoming calls half the time. - Unintuitive UI update. - Regular drop outs when using as data hotspot.Has anyone managed to get there phone back to KitKat and if so how did you do it?My phone is the Australian Dual Sim unlocked retail version.
Has anyone successfully downgraded there moto G v2 from lollipop?

I made the mistake of upgrading OTA to Lollipop (5.0.2) since then have been considering flushing the device down the toilet:  - Unable to answer incoming calls half the time. - Unintuitive UI update. - Regular drop outs when using as data hotspot.**Has anyone managed to get there phone back to KitKat** and if so how did you do it?My phone is the Australian Dual Sim unlocked retail version.*Apologies to anyone that thinks it is lazy for me not to wade through every generic answer and roll the dice on bricking the phone without at least asking if someone has succeeded (or failed) with identical circumstances.*
